Package BobcatLib.Logging

Class Alert

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Logging.Alert
public class Alert extends Object
Class for managing persistent alerts to be sent over NetworkTables. Alerts can be categorized by groups and urgency levels and displayed on the dashboard.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Alert.AlertType
    Represents an alert's level of urgency.

  • Constructor Details

    • Alert

      public Alert(String text, Alert.AlertType type)
      Creates a new alert in the default group "Alerts". If this is the first alert in the group, its entries will be added to NetworkTables.
      Parameters:
      text - The message text of the alert.
      type - The urgency level of the alert.

    • Alert

      public Alert(String group, String text, Alert.AlertType type)
      Creates a new alert in the specified group. If this is the first alert in the group, its entries will be added to NetworkTables.
      Parameters:
      group - The group identifier for the alert, also used as the NetworkTables title.
      text - The message text of the alert.
      type - The urgency level of the alert.

  • Method Details

    • set

      public void set(boolean active)
      Activates or deactivates the alert. If activated, the alert text is also sent to the console.
      Parameters:
      active - True to activate the alert, false to deactivate it.

    • setText

      public void setText(String text)
      Updates the text of the alert.
      Parameters:
      text - The new text for the alert.

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel(Alert.AlertType level)
      Updates the urgency level of the alert.
      Parameters:
      level - The new urgency level for the alert.

    • logAlert

      public void logAlert(String name)
      Logs metadata for the alert using the Logger.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the metadata entry.

    • getActivationTimestamp

      public double getActivationTimestamp()
      Retrieves the timestamp when the alert was activated.
      Returns:
      The activation timestamp.
